# What is VTK?
VTK (The Visualization Toolkit) is a powerful library for 3D computer graphics, image processing, and scientific visualization. In this interface, it enables interactive visual exploration of structured scientific data such as volumes and meshes.
After selecting a dataset, a 3D viewport will display the data, allowing you to explore it with zoom, rotation, and slicing tools.
## Key Features
- **Volume and Surface Rendering**: Visualize image volumes, meshes, and geometry with multiple rendering modes. - **Interactive Controls**: Rotate, zoom, and pan the view to explore data from any angle. - **Data Slicing and Probing**: Inspect cross-sections and internal structures with slicing and probe tools. - **High Performance**: Designed to efficiently handle large-scale scientific and medical datasets.
To learn more about VTK and its capabilities, visit: [https://vtk.org/documentation/](https://vtk.org/documentation/)
